data.title: Savers TV Ratings
data.meta_description: Generally the first episode and last episode of a series get above normal ratings because yeah, people want to see how it starts and ends. You see it happen...
data.text:
jpwong

I come from the net

Sep 27, 2006

#21

Generally the first episode and last episode of a series get above normal ratings because yeah, people want to see how it starts and ends. You see it happen in pokemon's ratings, and in most digimon series. The whole in between thing is a roller coaster depending on how good or bad the whole series is and how good each specific episode is percieved as being from the preview the previous week (or from magazine episode guides).

And while I don't know if Frontier got scaled back because of dumpster ratings, it did get scaled back a few episodes.

gerjomarty

I'm going digital

#22

Sad that that happened, it would have been nice to see what they were planning.

Glad that we made the Top 10 this week, although it seems like a hollow victory. Around 5% each week isn't that bad, and if merchandise is doing as well as we're led to believe, that's reassuring.

TV Ratings for the week of September 25 - October 1 (Ep25)

Sazae-san - 17.3

Chibimaruko - 11.8

Pokemon DP - 9.3

One Piece - 6.7

Dae Jang Geum - Janggeum`s Dream - 6.1

Nana - 5.9

Precure Star Splash - 5.6

????????? - 5.3

Digimon Savers - 5.2

Kirarin Revolution - 4.7

Well, we're still on, though I must note that Crayon Shin-Chan and Doreamon both didn't air this week.
